Description: Lower body fragment of East Greek pottery open vessel, krater or dinos. Two goats to left; preserved are the hindquarters and rear leg of the first, the horn of the second; outline rosettes as fill; bands of thinned glaze above and below the figured zone; added red on hindquarters and belly of the left goat.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 14, no. 42 pl. 10)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.914)
